title: P06-2012

sentences.text: This paper presents an unsupervised learning approach to disambiguate various relations between named entities by use of various lexical and syntactic features from the contexts .

It works by calculating eigenvectors of an adjacency graph 's Laplacian to recover a submanifold of data from a high dimensionality space and then performing cluster number estimation on the eigenvectors .
Experiment results on ACE corpora show that this spectral clustering based approach outperforms the other clustering methods .

Entity-an_unsupervised_learning_approach.label: an unsupervised learning approach
Entity-an_unsupervised_learning_approach.description: A methodology that uses eigenvectors of an adjacency graph's Laplacian to recover a submanifold of data from high dimensionality space and perform cluster number estimation, without requiring labeled training data.

Entity-calculating_eigenvectors_of_an_ad.label: calculating eigenvectors of an adjacency graph's Laplacian
aliases: calculating eigenvectors of an adjacency graph's Laplacian
Entity-calculating_eigenvectors_of_an_ad.description: The process of computing and analyzing the eigenvalues and eigenvectors resulting from applying the Laplace operator to the matrix representation of an undirected graph, used in spectral clustering algorithms for dimensionality reduction.

Entity-it_work.description: The method used in this paper's unsupervised learning approach to disambiguate various relations between named entities.

summary: This paper presents an unsupervised learning approach to disambiguate various relations between named entities by use of various lexical and syntactic features from the contexts . It works by calculating eigenvectors of an adjacency graph 's Laplacian to recover a submanifold of data from a high dimensionality space and then performing cluster number estimation on the eigenvectors . Experiment results on ACE corpora show that this spectral clustering based approach outperforms the other clustering methods .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is introducing or offering something to others. It implies a sense of provision, display, or exposition, where the subject is providing access to information, ideas, or concepts through the object.

Predicate-disambiguate_various_relations.label: disambiguate various relations between named entities
Predicate-disambiguate_various_relations.description: To clarify and distinguish different types of relationships or associations that exist among a set of identified entities (named entities), such as people, organizations, locations, etc. This process involves identifying and resolving ambiguities or uncertainties surrounding these relationships.

Predicate-disambiguate_various_relations.label: disambiguate various relations between
Predicate-disambiguate_various_relations.description: To identify and clarify the different types of relationships or connections that exist between two sets of entities (the subject and object), often involving semantic analysis to determine their meaning, context, and significance.

Predicate-calculates.label: calculates
Predicate-calculates.description: The predicate 'calculates' represents a mathematical operation that connects the subject to an object by describing how the subject processes or derives information from the object. In general, it indicates that the subject applies its own rules, methods, or algorithms to obtain some result or value related to the object.

Predicate-are_calculated_by.label: are calculated by
Predicate-are_calculated_by.description: The predicate 'are calculated by' indicates a relationship where the subject (in this case, eigenvectors) has its values determined or derived from the object (the Laplacian), often through some mathematical process or algorithm. This connection implies that the subject's properties or characteristics are obtained or inferred from the object.

Predicate-works_by.label: works by
Predicate-works_by.description: The predicate 'works by' indicates a means or method by which something (the subject) accomplishes its purpose, achieves its goal, or produces its effect. It describes how the subject operates, functions, or performs an action to produce the object.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: To demonstrate or prove something through evidence or demonstration. The predicate 'show that' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object, where the subject (e.g., an experiment) provides empirical support for the object (e.g., a spectral clustering based approach), thereby demonstrating its effectiveness or validity.

Predicate-outperforms.label: outperforms
Predicate-outperforms.description: Indicates that the subject has a superior performance or outcome compared to the object. The predicate suggests that the subject's method, technique, or approach yields better results than what is expected from the object.

Predicate-outperforms_the_other_clusteri.label: outperforms the other clustering methods
Predicate-outperforms_the_other_clusteri.description: The predicate 'outperforms' indicates that the subject (a method or algorithm for clustering data) achieves better results than all others in a comparison of multiple clustering approaches, as measured by some relevant performance metric. The object refers to these other methods collectively.

Predicate-show_that_this_spectral_cluste.label: show that this spectral clustering based approach outperforms
Predicate-show_that_this_spectral_cluste.description: This predicate indicates a comparison between two or more approaches to achieve a specific goal (e.g., clustering), where 'this spectral clustering based approach' represents one of the approaches being evaluated, and 'the other clustering methods' represent alternative approaches. The subject of this sentence is typically an experiment, study, results, or similar entity that provides evidence for the comparison.

skos:broader.label: uses
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates that the subject employs or utilizes a particular method, technique, process, or resource to achieve its purpose. It suggests an intentional and deliberate action of utilizing something for a specific goal.
